summary: The End Gun Violence Act of 2025 seeks to amend federal law to prohibit the sale or disposition of firearms or ammunition to individuals convicted of a "violent misdemeanor" within the preceding five years. A "violent misdemeanor" is defined as an offense under federal, state, tribal, or local law that includes as an element the use or threat of physical force or a deadly weapon, or the intent to cause physical injury, or knowingly causing physical injury. The bill also includes provisions for definitions, conforming amendments to related legislation, and an applicability clause. The amendments will not apply to convictions occurring prior to six months after the act's enactment.
